## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been following Verus for a while now, and I'm really interested in their approach to open-source development. Can you tell me how Verus's open-source approach contributes to the betterment of the crypto community?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus believes that through open-source development, mutual sharing of inventions and technology with others, and collaboration, they can build stronger systems that benefit society as a whole. By making their code open-source, they're allowing others to review, modify, and contribute to it, which can lead to faster bug fixes, new features, and a more secure overall system. This approach also fosters a sense of community and cooperation, which is essential for the growth and adoption of crypto technology.

**User:**
That makes sense. I've also been wondering, did Verus create their technology from scratch, or did they build upon an existing project?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, Verus did choose to use Komodo as a starting point for their technology. By doing so, they joined a vibrant ecosystem of independent, decentralized projects that work together, help each other, and cooperate by building on each other's contributions to a common code base. This collaboration has helped Verus achieve their goals and laid a foundation for their future journey. It's a great example of how open-source projects can benefit from each other's work and expertise.

**User:**
That's really interesting. How does Verus's cooperation with other projects, like Komodo, contribute to their innovation?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus believes in the spirit of a cooperating, decentralized, and independent open-source community. They have received help and advice from Komodo's lead developer, JL777, which has fast-tracked their understanding of Komodo's core and helped them improve it through their own enhancements and inventions. This cooperation has enabled Verus to achieve their goals and laid a foundation for their future journey. By working together, they can pool their resources, share knowledge, and accelerate innovation, which ultimately benefits the entire crypto community.
How does Verus's open-source approach contribute to the betterment of the crypto community?
Verus believes that through open-source development, mutual sharing of inventions and technology with others, and collaboration, they can build stronger systems that benefit society as a whole.

Title: Verus on the Spirit of Open Source, Community and Contributing to Crypto as a Whole
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/verus-on-the-spirit-of-open-source-community-and-contributing-to-crypto-as-a-whole-5dad716ac60c
Content:Verus on the Spirit of Open Source, Community and Contributing to Crypto as a Whole
What Open Source and Collaboration Means to Verus and How Verus is Contributing Back Upstream to the Komodo EcosystemBefore developing and releasing Verus, one of the most important decisions to make was a path towards building a blockchain capable of delivering on the Verus vision. By choosing Komodo as a starting point from which to develop its technology, the Verus project joined a vibrant ecosystem of independent, decentralized projects that work together, are willing to help each other, and cooperate by building on each others contributions to a common, or sometimes even just similar, code base.
Innovation in Cooperation
From the beginning of our development Komodo’s lead developer, JL777, offered help and advice as we dove into the Komodo technology and code. This fast tracked our understanding of Komodo’s core, helping us best leverage the Komodo technology and improve it through our own enhancements and invention, needed to launch the Verus main net.
This spirit of a cooperating, decentralized, and independent open source community has helped Verus achieve the goals we have to date and laid a foundation for the journey ahead.
Open Source and Innovation
We are an open source project. We believe that through development, open source, and mutual sharing of inventions and technology with others we can all build stronger systems for the betterment of society. This model allows each project and community to maintain their own vision, as we collectively develop solutions that are greater than the sum of their parts.
It is in this spirit that we upstrea
